<i>## [Rap]</i>
<i>#Word up, son, word #

<i># I got you stuck</i>
<i>off the realness #

<i># The Mobb comes equipped</i>
<i>for warfare #

<i># Beware of my crime family</i>
<i>who got enough shots to share #

<i># For all those</i>
<i>who want to profile and pose #

<i># Rock you in your face</i>
<i>Stab your brain with your nosebone #

<i># You all alone</i>
<i>in these streets, cousin #

<i># Every man for theyself</i>
<i>in this land we be gunnin'#</i>

<i># And keep them shook crews</i>
<i>runnin'like they suppose to #

<i># They come around</i>
<i>but they never come close to #

<i># I can see it inside your face</i>
<i>You're in the wrong place #

<i>and you will get touched #

<i>against my team #

<i># I guarantee it'll be your</i>

<i>and don't deserve to be a player#</i>

<i># My gunshots will</i>
<i>make you levitate #

<i># I'm only 19</i>
<i>but my mind is old #

<i># When the things get for real</i>
<i>my warm heart turns cold #

<i># Another n... a deceased</i>
<i>Another story gets told #

<i># It ain't nothin'really</i>
<i>Hey, yo, son spark that Phillie #

<i># So I can get my mind off</i>
<i>these yellowbacked n... s #

<i># Why they still alive</i>
<i>I don't know, go figure #

<i>[Knocking]</i>
Hold on a minute!

<i># I couldn't choose</i>
<i>a better location #

comments.text:
I'm watching it right now and googled about it's accuracy. Apparently this 
movie is not about Eminem's life. It's a movie about a fictional character 
played by Eminem. They are both white rappers from Detroit and that's about 
all Eminem has in common with the fictional character he plays in the 
movie. One would assume the movie is about Eminem's life, but it is not.﻿
